intro: Phyllanthus saxosus, commonly known as the stonecress, is a flowering plant native to arid and rocky environments. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent leaves. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh conditions, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems and leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Phyllanthus saxosus is often found in regions with limited soil and high sunlight exposure.
